title: [BUG] SKBitmap.SetPixel treating color type rgba8888 as bgra8888
body:
**Description**

<!-- a general description goes here -->
SKBitmap.SetPixel function treating color type rgba8888 as bgra8888, while color type bgra8888 works correctly.

**Code**

<!-- a snippet of code that demonstrates the issue -->
```csharp
SKBitmap testbmp = new SKBitmap(new SKImageInfo(32,32,SKColorType.Rgba8888,SKAlphaType.Premul));
testbmp.SetPixel(0,0,new SKColor(220,0,0,255));
SKColor c = testbmp.GetPixel(0, 0);
```
**Expected Behavior**

<!-- a general description of what was the expected behavior or result -->
testbmp.Bytes[0] == 220
testbmp.Bytes[1] == 0
testbmp.Bytes[2] == 0
testbmp.Bytes[3] == 255
c == ffdc0000

**Actual Behavior**

<!-- a general description of what really happened -->
testbmp.Bytes[0] == 0
testbmp.Bytes[1] == 0
testbmp.Bytes[2] == 220
testbmp.Bytes[3] == 255
c == ff0000dc

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  v1.68.0
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- all that apply, remove the platforms that aren't broken or haven't had any testing -->
  - UWP:  Windows 10, version 1803 (17134)
